Parameters: int: the value to be clamped.
clamp(int, int, int).Description: This method takes a numerical value and ensures it fits in a given numerical range. If the number is smaller than the minimum required by the range, then the minimum of the range will be returned. If the number is higher than the maximum allowed by the range then the maximum of the range will be returned.
clamp(int, int, int).FullName: int clamp (int value, int min, int max)

Parameters: double: the value to be clamped.
clamp(double, double, double).Description: This method takes a numerical value and ensures it fits in a given numerical range. If the number is smaller than the minimum required by the range, then the minimum of the range will be returned. If the number is higher than the maximum allowed by the range then the maximum of the range will be returned.
clamp(double, double, double).FullName: double clamp (double value, double min, double max)

Parameters: float: the value to be clamped.
clamp(float, float, float).Description: This method takes a numerical value and ensures it fits in a given numerical range. If the number is smaller than the minimum required by the range, then the minimum of the range will be returned. If the number is higher than the maximum allowed by the range then the maximum of the range will be returned.
clamp(float, float, float).FullName: float clamp (float value, float min, float max)

ClassDesc: A utility class providing functions useful for common mathematical operations.
